Params: {3: 'Within the crimson altar, bizarre, skeletal rocks ring a twisted, gnarled "tree" at its heart.'}
{3: 'The tree\'s roots plunge deep into the Red Tide, drawing the tide upward to feed the "monster" cradled at its heart.'}
{3: 'All along the trunk, fueled by the Red Tide\'s "nourishment," countless solid "hallucinations" bubble up within Chiko\'s nightmare.'}
{2: 'Yuko Kirishima', 3: "Still with me, but there's only one bullet left. Got any more for me?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Chiko Kirishima', 3: "Forget it. You've never been trained to use a gun.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Chiko just stands there, stunned, not knowing how to cross that impassable Red Tide to get her sister back.'}
{3: 'Yuko picks up the gun she gave her—'}
{1: '1', 3: "Chiko's eyes roll wildly as even more chaotic images surge from the Red Tide into her M.I.N.D."}
{3: 'Bianca, corrupted by the Red Tide and transformed into a "witch."'}
{3: 'Constellia in the waning days of the Golden Age.'}
{3: 'Yuko, who was transformed into a Construct, ultimately became a Corrupted, causing the deaths of many due to her own struggle...'}
{3: 'The countless fragmented images all seem to be pointing to the same "ending"—'}
{3: 'And that crystal known as the "Heteromer Shard" emerges from her lifeless body.'}
{3: 'The Vice-Captain of the Purifying Force, now called a "monster," asks herself this question in the dream.'}
{3: 'The fabricated Chiko answers in an equally soft tone.'}
{3: 'The ocean breathes heavily around them, perfectly serene.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Chiko', 3: "At least it's better than taking your own life in the Snowfields.", 4: '1'}
{3: "Is it right to take out a comrade who's become a Corrupted? Maybe so."}
{3: 'The Corrupted are cleared, and more comrades are saved.'}
{3: 'Is a death like hers justified? Perhaps so.'}
{3: 'She has merged with the Hetero-Humanoid, pushing past a distant boundary, sending information from the "future" to the "present."'}
{3: 'Human civilization marks this as a new turning point, and the world will remember her name.'}
{3: 'She swallows the bitterness of her life and stares out at the quiet sea.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Chiko', 3: 'Will there be a chance to tell Bianca what I just saw?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: "She'll know what to do. And she's the only one who can do it.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Young Chiko', 3: "I don't know. I don't know how many whispers of the sea can drift past those on land when the tide crashes upon the shore...", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Young Chiko', 3: "But I can get your message to Chaos. I saw her. She's right here.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'Her question hangs in the air as the two just sit by the shore in silence.'}
{3: 'The chaotic Red Tide is about to swallow this last isolated island.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Chiko', 3: "It doesn't matter anymore... If I can get this information to Bianca, so be it.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: "Will I get to see those who've already passed?", 4: '1'}
{3: 'She tucks her hair behind her ear as the crimson tide completely engulfs this lonely island.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Chiko', 3: 'By the way, did you hear what Yuko wanted to say to me just now?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: "The blue-haired girl opens her mouth, but nothing comes out. She's just silently mouthing words."}
{3: "It's like she says something, yet at the same time, nothing passes her lips."}
{3: 'Chiko manages a faint smile, letting the tide wash over her.'}
{3: 'The sea now lies calm, its surface undisturbed.'}
{3: 'The "monster" bound to the tree trunk opens her eyes.'}
{3: 'Lithos frowns, his gaze tracing each flawless data point. Something feels off, but...'}
{3: "But the experiment succeeded. Isn't this exactly what he and Mister had worked toward?"}
{3: "Obediently following the purple-haired Ascendant's lead, Chiko settles down in front of the altar."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lithos', 3: "Now... we'll just wait for Mister to join us and—", 4: '1'}
{3: "Before he can get the words out, the monster's razor-sharp limb flashes out."}
{3: "The metal execution chair doesn't even get a chance to fully envelop its master before the blade slashes across the purple-haired Ascendant's chest."}
{3: "Lithos can't utter a sound as he splits in two like a fragile autumn leaf."}
{3: 'As if nothing had happened, the "monster" returns to the altar.'}

{3: 'Perhaps driven by Hetero-Creature instinct—or maybe a flicker of awakening consciousness—she stands motionless at the altar, submerged in the depths of the Red Tide. As her eyes close, the Red Tide around her begins to churn slowly.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Vonnegut', 3: 'Absorbing... the Red Tide? What a futile struggle.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Vonnegut steps onto the island, only to immediately witness this "tragedy" unfold. Having noticed the "monster\'s" intention, he shakes his head.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Vonnegut', 3: '...Looks like it was all for nothing.', 4: '1'}
{3: "The monster doesn't hear the agent's mockery."}

{3: 'Suddenly, bizarre limbs hidden within her form erupt outwards, and the monster lets out a piercing shriek. Her body warps and twists, and the Red Tide around her keeps churning like boiling water...'}
{3: 'Vonnegut spots Lithos nearby and his brow furrows.'}
{2: 'Vonnegut', 3: 'While she could indeed be a "return ticket," this degree of instability...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The agent falls silent, deep in thought.'}
{3: 'In her current state, Chiko can now serve as his "return ticket," but her unstable consciousness poses the most fatal flaw in his entire scheme.'}
{3: 'While controlling the Hetero Tower, he cannot divide his attention to also manage this unstable "return ticket."'}
{3: 'But if he were to use Chiko as a vessel and try to continue the incubation with Cthylla...'}
{2: 'Vonnegut', 3: "It's a bit of a shame, really, but it's just not quite there.", 4: '1'}
{3: "He's not looking to take this risk, especially not with things as they are."}
{3: "Tucking away Lithos' damaged frame, Vonnegut logs Chiko's current status and data in his terminal."}
{3: 'Next on the agenda is pushing forward with the Cradle of Deep Blue project and the incubation of Cthylla, but first...'}
{3: 'He will find out what exactly happened to that tower.'}
